text: Hi there, can you please post this in #jobs? Thanks!
Hello! I'm unable to figure out what the API field would be for the 'deal status' and 'business unit' report fields. Can anyone tell me what API fields these may be and which API to pull these from?

Hi everybody, can anyone tell if the "old" Forms API is still working for the submission of data to a form? <https://legacydocs.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/forms/submit_form_v3_authentication#:~:text=As%20this%20API%20is%20authenticated%2C>
It is
Both the authenticated version and the no auth version
Hi someone knows who to get the contact and companies ids associated to a task with a search endpoint?
Hi anyone knows how can i integrate HubSpot with laravel and create custom objects

Hello! I've encountered a wall using the _search results system_ page from HubSpot and I was wondering if there's a way of ordering by date the results shown on the API call.

I wasn't able to find any parameter on the documentation and also, the filtering is done on the server. So the only solution I thought of is doing a custom results page retrieving all the results and re-doing the pagination myself...

If anyone has done this, please could you point me on the right direction? :thank-you:

Hi can anyone let me know why am i getting this error message even when i have created scope in the private app API generation process  "The scope needed for this API call isn't available for public use. If you have questions, contact support or post in our developer forum."

Hi two questions on forms api- will the authenticated version still work with API key with the transition away from API keys?

Second- I am working on a new signup flow in our app that will submit a form through the forms api... I currently am able to submit the form successfully when i submit without any "context" data (specifically trying to send hutk)- but i get a 400 when i attempt to add the hutk. Any help would be greatly appreciated!

1. think it should technically work but ultimately apikeys are a really bad way to handle intergrations like this because they are deprecated, youll definitely want to use a private app with the forms scope
2. Are you sending the hutk data as a string?
Oh hutk is meant to be used outside of context (nevermind, I didn't read the docs correctly)
Gotcha, i was looking at this in docs
Yep you are very right, I was looking at this, and missed the used in context part
Also that doc you sent me has no information on private app
only api key or oauth
And are you sure you're using a legitimate cookie?
OAuth is private app
or I should say private apps are a type of oauth

I have a custom website which I have added as a domain to HubSpot. I have disabled limiting cookies to specific subdomains.

with that I would hope that I can create HubSpot contacts via javascript with the original source taken from the HubSpot tracking cookie even if it was collected on another subdomain of ours. but somehow when I use the <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/conversation/chat-widget-sdk|conversations widget> or the tracking js lib and <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/events/tracking-code|identifying> the users with their email, they still don’t get added to HubSpot.

my question is: how to create contacts on HubSpot leveraging the original source in the tracking cookie.
Thank You.

I’m the middle of hooking HubSpot up to another system. I’m using the Webhooks. The easiest would be if HubSpot sends you the ID of the other system, but if that’s not possible. Do you use a table in the middle where you store both IDs or do I make a mistake thinking about it? :slightly_smiling_face:

Or you could just store the other systems id in HubSpot and the HubSpot id in the other system, you can also set that other systems id in HubSpot as a unique property and then update based on the id using the idProperty parameter
That’s what I just thought about… as I get the objectID at the change I could get with another GET the other ID in.
Let me try :slightly_smiling_face:
Sounds good, let me know how it goes

Hey, I've struggling with the basic integration.  I've created an app in HubSpot setup the auth.  I selected the scopes "`crm.objects.contacts.readcrm.objects.contacts.write"` .  The URL is now <https://app.HubSpot.com/oauth/authorize?client_id=********&scope=crm.objects.contacts.read%20crm.objects.contacts.write>, with the redirect given as well.  I'm getting the error message:

"*Couldn’t complete the connection*
This account doesn't have access to some HubSpot features that are required by this app. Please contact the app developer."

I've found a page that's supposed to walk through this but: a) I have the scopes in the URL and they match the app settings and  b) my account has super admin status.  So I really don't understand the issue.
nevermind.  I'm good now.
